From an abstract perspective, you might consider starting with the pattern language about unit testing written by Peter Gassmann.

It may not provide insight into the low-level details, but it is a good read nonetheless.

andrew f


It is available directly from:
http://www.coldewey.com/europlop2000/papers/gassmann.zip


  ----- Original Message ----- 
  From: nodoubt1222 
  To: junit@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Thursday, October 10, 2002 10:22 PM
  Subject: [junit] junit structure


  thanks heaps for the design patterns stuff!!
  i aslo need some info on the structure of junit and how it's classes 
  relate to each other. Or does anyone know where i can find info on 
  this. I've searched all over the web and found nothing!
